Considering the costs of most Windows servers i doubt that has anything to do with that. 
I can guarantee you that the amount of inexperienced people that try to configure a simple LAMP server every day out numbers the people who try to configure a MSFT server by several orders of magnitude.
MSFT just tries to harden the server as much as possible from the get go, as it assumes you won't need to use the internet to configure it or to download additional software from the internet. 
Whether the assumption is correct or not, a server coming out of the box in it's most hardened usable generic state is actually a preferred thing whether your an experienced user or a complete beginner.
